title: Make all voter fields optional except Name and Voter ID in both frontend and backend

requirements.text: Update the backend Voter type definition in backend/main.mo to make all fields optional except name and voterId. Fields that must become optional (accept null values) include: fatherHusbandName, address, gender, area, taluka, district, state, pincode, mobile, dob, caste, education, profession, office, politicalIdeology, comments, houseNumber, photo, signature, and educationalDocuments.

quotes: Backend validation: The backend will accept voters with only Name and Voter ID required - all other fields can be null/optional

acceptanceCriteria: The Voter type in backend/main.mo has name and voterId as required (non-null) fields
All other voter fields accept null or optional values in the type definition
The addVoter function successfully creates voter records with only name and voterId provided
Existing voters with all fields populated continue to work correctly

requirements.text: Update the addVoter function in backend/main.mo to remove validation requirements for all fields except name and voterId. The function must accept and store voter records where only name and voterId are provided, with all other fields as null or empty.

quotes: Backend validation: The backend will accept voters with only Name and Voter ID required

acceptanceCriteria: The addVoter function validates that name is non-empty
The addVoter function validates that voterId is non-empty
The addVoter function accepts null/empty values for all other fields without throwing errors
Voter records can be successfully created with minimal data (name + voterId only)

requirements.text: Update the VoterEntryForm component in frontend/src/components/VoterEntryForm.tsx to remove required validation from all fields except Name and Voter ID. All other form fields (Father/Husband name, Address, Gender, Area, Taluka, District, State, Pincode, Mobile no., DOB, Caste, Education, Profession, Office, Political ideology, Comments, House Number, Photo, Signature, Educational Documents) must remain visible on the form but become optional.

quotes: Form behavior: All fields remain visible on the form (not hidden)
make only Name and Voter ID compulsory

acceptanceCriteria: The Name field displays required indicator and prevents submission when empty
The Voter ID field displays required indicator and prevents submission when empty
All other fields do not show required indicators
Form can be successfully submitted with only Name and Voter ID filled
All fields remain visible in the form layout
No console errors appear when submitting a form with minimal data

requirements.text: Remove react-hook-form validation rules (required: true) from all optional fields in the VoterEntryForm component. Keep validation only for the name and voterId fields.

quotes: make only Name and Voter ID compulsory, while keeping all other fields visible but optional

acceptanceCriteria: The form's register() calls for optional fields do not include required validation rules
The name field retains its required validation rule
The voterId field retains its required validation rule
Form validation errors only appear for Name and Voter ID when they are empty
Users can skip any optional field without triggering validation errors

requirements.text: Verify that House Number field in the VoterEntryForm is optional and does not require a value for form submission, as confirmed by the user.

quotes: House Number: Confirmed as optional (not required)

acceptanceCriteria: House Number field does not show a required indicator
Form submits successfully when House Number is left empty
House Number field accepts alphanumeric text input

constraints: Do not hide any form fields - all fields must remain visible in the UI
Do not modify the useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui files
Preserve the single-actor backend architecture in backend/main.mo
Keep the existing Voter type fields intact - only change their optionality
Do not alter the House Number and Voter ID text input types that were previously changed from number to text
nonGoals: Hiding or removing any form fields from the VoterEntryForm
Adding new fields to the voter record
Changing the form layout or visual design
Modifying the Voter List page or other components
Creating a migration file (not needed for making fields optional)
